title: Calories in 6 oz Steak
meta_description: Discover calories in 6 oz steak, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Lean sirloin steak, grilled, trimmed of visible fat, cooked to medium; 6 oz ≈170 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, seasoning, and exact weight. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: 6 oz grilled lean sirloin steak provides ~350 kcal and ~52 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in 6 oz steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for 6 oz grilled lean sirloin steak.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 6 oz steak?
faqs.a: About 52 g of protein, making it a high-protein choice.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain grilled steak—it's mostly protein and fat.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in steak?
faqs.a: Grilling or broiling keeps calories lower; frying in oil adds 40+ kcal per tsp per 100 g.

faqs.q: What cut of steak is this for?
faqs.a: Based on lean sirloin; fattier cuts like ribeye increase calories to ~270 kcal per 100 g.
